content: Jiaoyan Chen Jiaoyan Chen Contact Information Office: 2.91, Kilburn Building, Oxford Road, Manchester M13 9PL UK Email: firstname.lastname@manchester.ac.uk, firstname4ai@gmail.com Hive, LinkedIn, CV, Google Scholar Biography Jiaoyan is a Senior Lecturer (Associate Professor) in Department of Computer Science, The University of Manchester. Before that, he was a Lecturer in Manchester (from Nov 2022), a Senior Researcher in Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford (with Prof. Ian Horrocks from Nov 2017), and a postdoctoral in Heidelberg University. Jiaoyan got his PhD and bachelor degrees both in Zhejiang University on Computer Science and Technology in 2016 and 2011, respectively. He was a visiting PhD in Department of Informatics, Zurich University from 2014 to 2015. News! 10 Nov: visit Shanxi University and give a presentation 9 Nov: one paper on benchmarking LLM reasoning accepted by AAAI'26 1 Nov: one paper on knowledge graph and RAG accepted by Information Fusion Research Interests Knowledge Representation: construction and curation of knowledge graphs and ontologies, semantic techniques. Machine Learning: knowledge representation learning, semantic embedding, neural-symbolic integration. Data and Knowledge Management for AI: evaluating and augmenting large language models (LLMs) with knowledge graphs, ontologies and structured data. PhD / MPhil Recruiting Please email me before applying online, if you have interests in the following PhD projects RAG project, LLM explanability and evaluation project, or other topics that fall into my scope. MPhil (research-oriented master, usually self-funded) applications are also welcomed. I am also open to application of visiting PhD, but only consider topics within my interests. As there are so many enquires and applicants, I will not be able to respond to all of them, but only those qualified (e.g., oversee PhD applicants require outstanding academic performance evidenced by more than one of the following: excellent transcripts, degree from top universities, top publications with key contributions, and outstanding final-year project mark).
